Geniale. Portal 2 è il seguito di un gioco che avevo trovato brillante, e comprarne il sequel non mi ha deluso. La storia è semplice ma molto bella, gli enigmi sono chiari, ma raramente semplici, l'umorismo poi è a dir poco incredibile. Assolutamente un must play.
Un gran juego que nunca se queda antiguo y en el que siempre encontrarás cámaras que jugar.
Miło połamać sobie trochę głowę po tych wszystkich Battlefieldach...

This could be the greatest game of all-time.

A puzzle game, disguised as a first-person shooter, Portal 2 continues the story of the original Portal, and further builds on the chemistry between the silent protaganist (you) and the dry, witty yet homicidal A.I. controlling the facility you're trapped in.

You start in a setting post-Portal, but wind up taking a tour of Aperture Science's past through a buried labyrinth of forgotten test chambers, as you learn the origins of the 'science' and GLaDOS.

Stephen Merchant hilariously adds his talent to the voice cast as the bumbling Wheatley, and J. K. Simmons lends his stalwart, matter-of-fact tone to the newly introduced Cave Johnson, founder of Aperture.

I can't imagine a more well-written or better voiced script.  You're guaranteed to love it!
This was a triumph.

Released back in 2011, coming up on it's 10th birthday.
A simple 2-4 hour story game with fancy orange and blue puzzles. Sassy robots telling you what you should do and shouldn't do. An old man yelling about lemons, and a surprisingly deep story and lore to another memorable Valve game.

What are you waiting for? Another 10 years? Buy it already.

Although I already owned and played Portal 2 on Xbox 360, I also got it on sale on Steam one day because I love the game so much. Portal 2, like the first game, is a puzzle/problem solving game where you need to go through different "test" chambers, using only what is around you and your portal gun. The storyline in Portal 2 is a lot more complex and longer than it's predecessor, though, and your objective is to escape the testing facility. There is also a lot more dialogue in this game, although your own character never actually says anything. Along the way, there will be many comical moments as well, making the game very enjoyable.

I don't want to spoil anything so I will stop myself, but if you like the original Portal game, or even if you have never played it before, I am sure you will definitely love this game.
